plugins.name: Unsplash
plugins.description:
Insert beautiful images from Unsplash into your designs.


The Unsplash License allows images to be used freely for both commercial and personal projects.


Learn more about Unsplash at https://unsplash.com/about


Unsplash+

If you have an active Unsplash+ subscription, you can connect your account to access non-watermarked, full-resolution images.


Learn more about Unsplash+ and the Unsplash+ License.


How to Install

  1. Bookmark the plugin to save it to your plugins
  2. Click Open in... and select a file
  3. Right click in a file to open the context menu go to ▸ Plugins ▸ Saved plugins ▸ Unsplash
  4. Learn more about plugins here ↗

plugins.name: Figma to Code (HTML, Tailwind, Flutter, SwiftUI)
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to tedious manual coding. Whether you’re a designer or developer, this plugin effortlessly converts your Figma layouts into responsive webpages (HTML, Tailwind, Svelte, or styled-components) or mobile apps (Flutter or SwiftUI) — all while preserving every detail of your original design.


Why You’ll Love It

  1. Save Time: Automate the conversion process and skip hours of repetitive work.
  2. Great Results: Optimized layouts and clean, accurate code that matches your vision.
  3. Total Flexibility: Choose your preferred framework.
  4. Fast: This is the fastest design to code plugin.
  5. Privacy Guaranteed: Your designs stay secure. All processing happens locally on your device — no data ever leaves your computer.


What Sets Us Apart

  1. Free: No costs, no in-app purchases.
  2. Open-Source: Built by community for community.
  3. Top-Notch Quality: Generates code that follows the best design and programming practices.
  4. Age: This plugin is over 5 years old and has worked with every Tailwind version since the first one.


Supported Formats

  1. Web: HTML, Tailwind, React (JSX), Svelte, styled-components
  2. Mobile: Flutter, SwiftUI


Privacy policy

This app collects no data, works completely offline. Since no personal data is collected or stored, there is no risk of your information being compromised. I do not employ cookies, trackers, or any other methods to gather information about you. I welcome your questions or concerns about this privacy policy. Feel free to contact me for clarifications.

accepted.name: Bernardo Ferrari
accepted.description: Developer that likes design (and Figma).

plugins.tagline: Code Conversion Made Easy: Figma to Web & Apps

plugins.name: Icons8 — icons, illustrations, photos
plugins.description:
Keep your flow with the largest and most consistent collection of curated graphics. Get 1.5M+ icons, photos, and illustrations without ever needing to leave Figma!


* We offer an extensive free tier. All we ask is for you to add a link back to icons8.com, crediting us in the final work.

 

Features

• Icons: consistent, pixel-perfect, in 40+ styles, made by the best icon designers

• Illustrations: flat and 3D, vector and raster, created by top Dribbble artists

• Photos: people, objects, and animals, ready-to-use shots, and background-free elements, taken by a movie-scale crew

• You can search by keywords and sort by styles and categories

 

Free with in-app purchases

• Thousands of icons, illustrations, and photos are free for a link

• Or you can subscribe to one of the pro plans and get editable or high-res graphics and forget about linking

 

How to use

• Use tabs to switch between icons, illustrations, and photos

• To add an image to your project, simply click over it or drag-and-drop it onto the canvas

• Use the drop-down menus to select from various icon styles, sizes, and formats

• If you have an Icons8 account, click menu (☰) → Sign in/Sign up

 

Pro License

We offer both free and paid features within this plugin. Free access is limited to PNG in smaller sizes, whereas pro subscriptions grant a commercial license to all graphics in any format.


Check out AI-powered tools to help you get great visuals

  1. Smart Upscaler to make images bigger without losing quality
  2. Face Swapper to make high-res and high-quality face swaps
  3. Generated Photos to get worry-free and diverse avatars for your designs
  4. Face Generator to create a unique person with your parameters in one click

accepted.name: Icons8 Team
accepted.description: Free design resources and software. Crafting beautiful icons, illustrations, music, and photography for your projects.

plugins.tagline: All our graphics at your fingertips.

plugins.name: html.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Import websites to Figma designs (web,html,css)
plugins.description:
Converts any website into fully editable Figma designs.

Leverage an existing website and import its HTML to Figma to start your own designs, without building each element from scratch.


👉 Homepage

📖 Documentation

💬 Chat with us


How to import a website into Figma?

  1. In Figma, go to the plugin menu and start html.to.design plugin
  2. Enter the url of the website to import into Figma
  3. Chose the viewports to import (mobile, desktop, tablet...)
  4. Click on import


Import private website or behind login websites?

  1. Download our Chrome extension.
  2. Follow instructions in documentation.


Import HTML+CSS code

  1. Use the new "Editor" tab to import HTML/CSS code directly
  2. Edit and update incrementally


Import via MCP (New)

  1. Fastest MCP server!
  2. Connect your AI tool - Claude Desktop and Cursor are supported
  3. Generate designs with AI and send them to Figma
  4. You can automate URL imports too!


Why use html.to.design?

  1. Redesign an existing website, without building a single thing from scratch.
  2. Capture websites for a benchmark or moodboard in Figma, without a single screenshot. 
  3. Load an editable webpage in Figma for collaboration, providing comments and feedback.
  4. Improve your UX writing with different copy, and get a snapshot of exactly how it’ll look.
  5. Scrap a website to import missing design assets for ongoing projects.
  6. Use AI (with MCP) to bootstrap your work or get inspirations


FREE plan

  1. Up to 10 imports every 30 days


PRO plan

  1. Unlimited imports (fair use)
  2. High-resolution images
  3. Multiple URLs or .h2d files at once
  4. Re-import URLs in one click
  5. Premium support


------------------------------

Brought to you by ‹div›RIOTS

------------------------------

networkAccess.reasoning: html.to.design does not transmit any information about your Figma files. The html.to.design backend converts URLs to a Figma model, which is only stored temporarily on Google Storage (storage.googleapis.com) for the plugin to download. We collect anonymous usage data (via divriots.com) to improve the Figma plugin experience. Firebase is used to enable secure authentication and storage of files received by the browser extension.

plugins.name: Anima - Figma to Code React, HTML, CSS, Tailwind, MUI (DevMode Inspect React / HTML / Vue / CSS)
plugins.description:
AI Powered Figma to Code, right in your favorite tool.


Get code, based on your design, and accelerate the design to development process.


What can you do with Anima?


👩‍💻 Export Figma to code (HTML, React, or Vue code with CSS, Tailwind CSS or Styled Components)

  1. Convert Figma designs or components into interactive and responsive code, and React components in Dev Mode
  2. Share with developers, giving them the power to produce code according to their preferences
  3. Select UI Libraries (Shadcn, MUI)


✨ New! Anima’s Playground with AI Chat

The first UI-driven AI platform that understands both design and development.


🔹 Pixel-perfect UI – Generate high-quality shadcn + Tailwind code that’s production-ready

🔹 AI-powered iteration – Modify and improve your design with natural language prompts

🔹 Live previews – See changes instantly as you edit your code

🔹 Connect more screens – Add images, logos, and additional Figma screens with simple instructions

🔹 One-click publishing – Deploy your site or app directly through Anima

🔹 Own your code – Export to GitHub or download locally anytime

🔹 Powered by Bolt.new – Built for seamless development with the Bolt IDE


With Anima’s Playground, you can refine and customize code before exporting, ensuring it matches your needs—saving valuable development time.


✨ You can still prompt within Figma with Anima's plugin and customize the code Anima generates with free prompts, presets and code samples


🎨 Build code-based prototypes

  1. Create prototypes that feel like the real product
  2. Add charts, videos, live text inputs, google maps, drop-down menus, entrance animations, and embed any type of code with Anima
  3. Make your designs fully responsive with breakpoints and constraints support


🔗 Share a live URL with your team and users

  1. Get team feedback
  2. Perform user testing with a public or a private link
  3. Impress your stakeholders and clients with stunning demos


📩 Export Figma to email HTML with inline CSS

From Figma to Inbox

  1. In the plugin - Switch to ‘component code inspect’ / Or open in Dev mode.
  2. Select the framework & styling ‘HTML’ + ‘Email compatible’
  3. Open in playground and copy the code, including the links to the assets.


What does Anima’s developer-friendly code look like?

  1. Reusable code components: Anima automatically recognizes repeating components and minimizes code duplications. The result is code that is easy to read and maintain.
  2. Automatic flex-box layout: Anima’s Auto-Flexbox layout allows relative position for dynamic content.
  3. Zero dependencies: Anima’s code is meant to save engineers time while giving them complete control of the code.


Join our Anima Community on Twitter and Discord 👋🏻


Got questions?

We’ve got the answers! Check out our Help Center for dozens of helpful articles 💡


Figma to React: https://www.animaapp.com/blog/design-to-code/how-to-export-figma-to-react

plugins.name: Lorem Ipsum — by ‹div›RIOTS
plugins.description:
Fill your designs with placeholders in a click: text, images and even data!


  1. Generate ‘Lorem ipsum’ to fill your text layers,
  2. Fill any shape with the perfect image from the Unsplash archives,
  3. Populate designs with fake data, such as profiles or company info.


Auto-generate ✨

‘Auto-generate’ will automatically fill the selected layers with the perfect amount of ‘Lorem ipsum’ to fit their existing frame.


Fill any shape with an image 🖼️

Search the Unsplash archives and choose from thousands of images that you can apply to any shape or fill.


Use fake data for more realistic designs 📊

You can now also populate your text (and image) layers with fake data. Simulate a personal profile... Replicate an e-commerce site... Take your placeholders to the next level!


Want to use real data in your designs?

Try our plugin data.to.design to set up powerful mappings and apply your own data to Figma designs.


Quick actions ⌨️

There’s support for Figma’s Quick Actions — quickly generate text without needing to open the plugin window… use ⌘ + / (mac)or ctrl + / (windows) to bring up the actions bar, type “Lorem ipsum” and then press ‘tab’ to progress to pick the type and count of text to generate.


------------------------------

plugins.name: Builder.io - AI-Powered Figma to Code (React, Vue, Tailwind, & more)
plugins.description:
Use AI to generate clean, responsive code, create on-brand designs, or convert websites to Figma - all in real-time.


Convert Figma to Code

- No setup: No need to do anything special to your design files before you turn them into code

- Any framework: Generate React, Next.js, Vue, Svelte, Angular, Swift, Flutter, Kotlin, React Native, HTML and more. Choose your preferred styling library, whether it's Tailwind CSS, CSS Modules, Emotion, Styled Components, or Styled JSX

- Automatically responsive: Generated code is automatically responsive, even when your designs don’t use auto layout

- Leverage existing components: Map Figma components to code components to reuse existing components during code generation.

- Easy to read, improve, and export code: Generated code is clean code and developer-friendly so it’s easy to read, edit, update, and integrate it with your existing JavaScript and HTML code for web pages and apps


Generate on-brand Figma designs with AI

- Create Figma designs that match your brand by analyzing your existing assets and patterns

- Describe what you need—landing pages, forms, dashboards—and get brand-consistent designs instantly

- Iterate using natural language commands like "make the header more prominent" or "add a secondary action button"

- Generate all UI states, including error, loading, and empty states, without tedious manual work

- Build interactive prototypes and application starters with working interactions directly in Figma


Website to Figma: Convert websites into editable designs

- Import any website directly into Figma as fully editable elements

- Save design inspiration from the web and iterate on it without rebuilding from scratch

- Capture complete website structures with all elements preserved for easy customization

plugins.name: Content Reel
plugins.description:
Design layouts more efficiently by pulling text strings, images, and icons from one palette. Content Reel lets you create custom content and share it with other Figma users. Collaboration has never been easier!


Content:

Browse or search content to find published collections of text strings, images, and icons. Having trouble finding what you need from existing content? You can create your own text and image content by using Add.


Add:

Create text categories and populate them with your own text strings. You can also upload up to 20 PNGs or JPEGs to create image content. As a creator, you may choose to share it publicly or keep it private. When you create content, it is automatically pinned to Home Screen for quick access (signed-in users only).


Customize Your Home screen:

Optimize your workflow by pinning the content that you use most to your home screen. Apply 1-click access to any content type with the switch of a toggle (signed-in users only). Drag and drop items on your home screen to suit your preferences.


How to use Content Reel:


Find content:

Access saved content from your Home Screen or navigate through the tabs to search or browse content. Pin it for ease of access to your Home screen.


Applying text content:

Select one or more text layers in your design to apply strings individually or apply them all. Use the original order provided or choose an order from the drop-down menu.


Applying image content:

Select one or more image layers or frames in your design, then apply the images individually or apply them all in random order.


Applying icon content:

Browse the collection or use the search bar to find an icon. Click on the icon or drag and drop it into your design. Change the format between glyph or SVG by clicking on the settings menu. You can also adjust the icon size to scale as needed. When using glyphs make sure the selected font is downloaded and installed in Figma.


Creating text and image content: Navigate to the Add tab, click Add, and select content type. Provide a Title that is relevant to your content. Set your content to Public or Private. See the terms and conditions regarding usage and rights.


—


Got more ideas?

Send them our way at designtools@microsoft.com

Or join the Spectrum community at https://spectrum.chat/content-reel

www.contentreel.design

plugins.name: Autoflow
plugins.description:
Automagically draw flow arrows in Figma! Illustrate user flows, diagrams, or graphics in a hand-drawn or minimalist style.


Autoflow is free up to 50 flows per file.


Features

  1. Intelligent obstacle detection
  2. Text annotations on path
  3. Custom path routing
  4. Auto-update on moving
  5. Offset start/end terminal spacing
  6. Multiple terminal styles
  7. Pause drawing mode so you can keep the plugin open while working


Get started instantly

  1. Free for up to 50 flows per file
  2. Use across an unlimited number of files


No subscription fees

Get individual lifetime access to Autoflow for a one-time fee of $49 $29 (limited time offer).


This gives...

  1. Unlimited flows per file
  2. All future updates
  3. Support from the developer


--


FAQ


I’m an existing user from before the paid version. What happens to my flows?

Existing flows drawn before the release of the paid version will not count toward the limit. Users of these files will receive 50 free flows on top of existing flows per file.


Do flows that I draw and delete count toward my free flow limit?

Deleted flows won’t count toward the limit. Only flows present on the canvas are counted.


Do you offer business or organization pricing?

Bulk pricing is currently not supported by the Figma plugins marketplace.


Where can I submit feedback or a feature request?

Please DM @davidtzhao on Twitter or email autoflowplugin@gmail.com for inquiries, support, and all else!

plugins.name: IconScout - 3D Assets, Lottie Animations, Icons & Illustrations + Unicons + AI Tools
plugins.description:
🎨 IconScout For Figma - Access 11.3 Million+ design assets seamlessly right within Figma


Unleash your creativity with IconScout for Figma, the ultimate Figma plugin that takes your designs to the next level. Whether you’re a seasoned pro or just starting out, our feature-packed plugin has essential design elements and premium content.

Bring your designs to life without leaving Figma, ready for any digital platform.


Key Features:

👥 Guest Mode: Let your creativity shine without the hassle of login – accessible for everyone.

🖼️ Icons: Explore a vast library of millions of icons to enhance your user interface effortlessly.

🌐 3D Illustrations: Add depth and realism with stunning 3D illustrations featuring 360 glTF views.

🚀 Lottie Animations: Boost user engagement by incorporating dynamic and engaging Lottie animations.

💎 Illustrations: Infuse personality into your projects with a diverse collection of illustrations.

🌟 Unicons as Default Profile (Enhanced Icon Experience): We've made Unicons the default profile in the plugin's sidebar. With their sleek and modern design, Unicons provide a versatile and high-quality icon set ready to use in your projects.

🌈 Lottie Color Swapper: Change colors in your Lottie animations effortlessly. Customize and fine-tune your designs like never before.

🎨 Custom Color Palette: Tailor your designs precisely using our custom color palette feature.

🔎 Reverse Image Search: Discover a world of inspiration with our powerful Reverse Image Search feature, finding similar images effortlessly.

💼 Team Access: You can collaborate with your team members never like before. Share and access design assets with your entire team directly inside the IconScout Figma plugin. It will allow you to use your team color palette and collections to simplified your team work efficiency.

💎 Premium Content: Level up your designs with premium icons, illustrations, 3D illustrations and Lottie animations.

✨ AI Asset Generator: Instantly generate custom illustrations and 3D assets using prompts – no design skills required.

🧩 PNG to SVG Vectorizer: Turn raster images into clean, scalable SVGs with a single click.

🧼 Background Remover: Remove image backgrounds using the AI and keep your focus on what matters.


⚙️ How to Use:

  1. Install IconScout for Figma from the Figma community.
  2. Explore a world of design possibilities – icons, 3D illustrations, Lottie animations, and illustrations.
  3. Customize effortlessly with the built-in color palette and unlock premium content with a subscription.


💬 Feedback & Support: Your feedback is invaluable to us! Reach out for comments, inquiries, or assistance at support@iconscout.com.

plugins.description:
Create animations with ease:

LottieFiles for Figma redefines animation creation, enabling designers to effortlessly convert their designs into Lottie animations. This powerful feature supports everything from basic animations to multi-frame and multi-variant component sequences.


Utilize the full suite of Figma features including components, gradients and custom shapes, and transform them into engaging micro-animations.


Over 500,000 free and premium animations to get you started.


You don't need to be a motion design expert; simply prototype and export your animations as production-ready Lottie animations. Bring your designs to life without leaving Figma, ready for any digital platform.


🌐 Core Features:

plugins.name: Artboard Mockups
plugins.description:
Access Artboard Studio's extensive library of high-quality mockups directly within Figma. Choose from a wide range of categories including devices, packaging, apparel, and print. Effortlessly transform your Figma designs into realistic product mockups with just a click. Our library is continuously expanding, with new items added daily to provide you with endless creative possibilities.


Demo video: https://artboard.studio/figma-mockup


How to use:

  1. Click on Login or Sign up to link your Figma account to your Artboard Studio account.
  2. All imported items are fully layered and customizable.
  3. Items that have renderable labels come with relevant frames. Place your designs into those frames, make sure the frame is selected and click Render Selected Frame.
  4. You can resize frames and mockup items, it will still work as long as you keep the aspect ratio.
  5. To unlock access to our premium items, subscribe to one of our premium plans. It will automatically unlock all items next time you use the Artboard Studio plugin in Figma.
  6. Use the menus on the top of the items to search and filter items based on name, viewpoint, and category.
  7. Happy Designing 😉


Can you do mockups in Figma?

Yes, you can create mockups in Figma using various plugins. However, for the most extensive library of high-quality and realistic mockup content, Artboard Studio stands out. With its vast collection of assets, you can easily access a wide range of elements to enhance your designs and achieve professional results.

How do you save a mockup in Figma?

Once you've placed your design within customization frames and completed the mockup item customization process, simply select the main frame. Then, navigate to the Export section located in the right sidebar. From there, you can easily export your design in any desired format and resolution to suit your needs.

plugins.name: Noise
plugins.description:
Make some noise in Figma!


Noise is a handy tool when you need to add more realism to your work or to simply mask banding in gradients.


Use smoothing to simulate clouds or smudges and wear, or reduce the depth of your noise for a hard edge. Stretch for a brushed effect. Use vignetting to add density to your noise towards the outer edges. Or modify the color of your noise while mixing with blend modes to achieve some truly professional texturizing effects in your work.


Features


  1. (NEW) Vignette — Increases the density of noise around the edges of your noise pattern which can create a more natural look in your designs.
  2. (NEW) Stretch — The new stretch slider allows you to stretch your noise out for grain and brushed texture effects.
  3. (NEW) Depth — Using the new depth slider you now have control over how many shades are used in produce noise for your designs: from a hard edged 1-bit noise to an intricate 256 shades.
  4. Smoothing — Generate clouds, wear, smudges, landscapes, and other textures by mixing the smoothing slider with other options in Noise.
  5. Color — With Noise you have full control over the color of the noise it generates using the built-in color picker or using hex value directly.
  6. Smart Sizing — Noise will automatically detect the texture size you want based on the selected object in Figma. Adding noise automatically creates an image fill layer for you on the selected object.

accepted.name: Dustin Mierau
accepted.description: Cofound and led design at Path. Helped build Napster for macOS. Making Figma plugins that I find useful in my own work and hope you do too. 😊

plugins.tagline: Pixel perfect noise texture generation for Figma.

plugins.name: Table Creator
plugins.description:
Create custom-styled tables which can be easily resized, edited and automatically adjust to content. Control the design of your tables by modifying the components. Update all tables, anytime your design changes. Use the plugin commands to make selecting columns and rows easier.


Watch the video to see the plugin in action.


Creating a table


  1. Run the command Create Table
  2. Follow the onboarding prompts
  3. Customise your table (see options below)
  4. Click Create Table


Once you've created a template, you can customise the look of your tables by changing the template.


See the Table Creator Starter Kit for examples of creating more complex tables.


Number of columns and rows


Choose how many columns and rows you want. Up to a maximum of 50. Use the $ symbol if you want the number of columns or rows to be based on the template.


Table width and height


Tables are created by default with a specific width. Once created you can resize the table to the width you desire. To change it so the width or height is determined by the number of columns or rows, just enter HUG as the value. Use the $ symbol if you want the width or height to be based on height or width of the template.


Cell width


Enter any numeric value you want for the cell width. Change the value to FILL if you want them to resize with the table, rather than be a fixed width. Use the $ symbol if you want the width be based on the template.


Using with libraries


Only works if you are on the Professional plan or above.


  1. Create a template in your library
  2. Publish the template
  3. Run the plugin in the file you wish to use the library with
  4. Choose Import Template
  5. Open the Assets panel and drag an instance of each template onto the canvas
  6. Select the library from the list of recent files
  7. Click Import


Once a template has been imported, other people will be able to use the templates with that file as well.


If you create or delete any templates since adding the library, you must run the plugin again in the library or import the new templates.


Editing text


  1. While holding down cmd/ctrl double-click the centre of a cell to edit its text.


To include other content in a cell, create another variant of the cell in your template. Then you can include other content like icons or form controls. When you create a table, select the cells you want to change and choose the new variant type from the Property Panel in Figma.


Selecting cells


  1. Hold down cmd/ctrl while hovering over the edge/border of cell
  2. Hold down shift + cmd/ctrl to select multiple cells (use command below to select all cells in a column or row)


Selecting columns and row


  1. Select one or more cells
  2. Run the command Select Column or Select Row
  3. Plugin will select all cells in the current column/row
  4. Resize or reorder to your heart's content :)


Column and row resizing


By default Column Resizing is enabled. After you have created a table, resize the cells in the first row to control the size of the columns. You can toggle Column Sizing on and off by selecting the table and clicking Toggle Resizing in the Properties Panel, under Plugin.


Detached cells


By default when a table is created the cells remain connected to their main component. To disable this and detached them when the table is created, open the plugin UI window click icon with the three dots and enable Detached Cells.


Switching between columns or rows


Change a table from columns or rows or vice versa


  1. Select a table
  2. Then from the Properties Panel under Plugin click Switch Axes.


Using with plugin parameters


You can create tables easily using plugin parameters. Using the Quick Actions bar search for "Create Table" and then press tab.


  1. Choose the template you want your table to be created from
  2. Choose how many columns and rows you want your table to have, eg 4x10 (4 columns and 10 rows)
  3. Choose what size you want your table to be, eg 600xHUG
  4. Press enter to create the table


Duplicating tables


When you duplicate a table that was created using Column Resizing (default), it contains a local component for the first row. That means when it's duplicated, the copy is intrinsically linked. To get around this you can either reapply column sizing or detach the table and it's rows.


Warning: This is quite an intensive process so it can take up to a couple of minutes.


  1. Select a table
  2. Then from the Properties Panel under Plugin click Toggle Resizing or Detach Table.


Inserting a column


Adding a new column after creating a table can be a little tricky. The plugin has a command which makes this easier. Just select a table or a specific cell and run Insert Column from the Quick Actions menu. Then select whether you want the new column to appear before or after the selected cell and how many columns you want to be inserted.


Configuring a template


If you remove or change any parts of the template you may need to re-configure the template.


Choose a template to configure:


  1. Run the command Create Table
  2. Select the dropdown at the top of the UI window
  3. Make sure Local Templates is selected
  4. Hover over the template you wish to configure
  5. Click the pencil icon


To configure parts of the template:


  1. Select a layer inside the template on the canvas
  2. Now in the plugin window, hover over a part in the list and click the plus icon
  3. If you want to remove a part from the configuration, just click the minus icon


Some layers can't be configured as certain parts. When configuring a part, make sure the part is not a group, or vector.


Moving table components


If you want to move any of the components used by the plugin to another file you can do this by following the guidance from Figma on moving components.


Relinking tables to templates


Sometimes, a table may lose its connection to a template, preventing it from refreshing properly. This occurs when the table's stored metadata becomes outdated or corrupt. To fix this, select the affected tables and click the link icon next to the template in the template dropdown.


Relinking will not swap any instances that exist in the table if they have changes and that will need to be done manually.


Limitations


  1. This plugin won't let you manage your rows as variants. This is tricky to do, it may be something I can add in a future update.
  2. Merging cells is not supported. Unfortunately, it's too difficult to enable this reliably.
  3. The only way to create columns that hug to their contents is to switch axes to columns
  4. If you create a table without a header and use Column Resizing the text is replicated in each cell in the column
  5. Support for hover states on rows is unfortunately not possible because rows are not built using components (that's how the plugin allows you to resize columns). There are workarounds but they don't suit every use case.

plugins.tagline: Easily create tables that can be edited, resized and maintained using your design system

125922.name: Table Creator
125922.description:
Create custom-styled tables which can be easily resized, edited and automatically adjust to content. Control the design of your tables by modifying the components. Update all tables, anytime your design changes. Use the plugin commands to make selecting columns and rows easier.


Watch the video to see the plugin in action.


Creating a table


  1. Run the command Create Table
  2. Follow the onboarding prompts
  3. Customise your table (see options below)
  4. Click Create Table


Once you've created a template, you can customise the look of your tables by changing the template.


See the Table Creator Starter Kit for examples of creating more complex tables.


Number of columns and rows


Choose how many columns and rows you want. Up to a maximum of 50. Use the $ symbol if you want the number of columns or rows to be based on the template.


Table width and height


Tables are created by default with a specific width. Once created you can resize the table to the width you desire. To change it so the width or height is determined by the number of columns or rows, just enter HUG as the value. Use the $ symbol if you want the width or height to be based on height or width of the template.


Cell width


Enter any numeric value you want for the cell width. Change the value to FILL if you want them to resize with the table, rather than be a fixed width. Use the $ symbol if you want the width be based on the template.


Using with libraries


Only works if you are on the Professional plan or above.


  1. Create a template in your library
  2. Publish the template
  3. Run the plugin in the file you wish to use the library with
  4. Choose Import Template
  5. Open the Assets panel and drag an instance of each template onto the canvas
  6. Select the library from the list of recent files
  7. Click Import


Once a template has been imported, other people will be able to use the templates with that file as well.


If you create or delete any templates since adding the library, you must run the plugin again in the library or import the new templates.


Editing text


  1. While holding down cmd/ctrl double-click the centre of a cell to edit its text.


To include other content in a cell, create another variant of the cell in your template. Then you can include other content like icons or form controls. When you create a table, select the cells you want to change and choose the new variant type from the Property Panel in Figma.


Selecting cells


  1. Hold down cmd/ctrl while hovering over the edge/border of cell
  2. Hold down shift + cmd/ctrl to select multiple cells (use command below to select all cells in a column or row)


Selecting columns and row


  1. Select one or more cells
  2. Run the command Select Column or Select Row
  3. Plugin will select all cells in the current column/row
  4. Resize or reorder to your heart's content :)


Column and row resizing


By default Column Resizing is enabled. After you have created a table, resize the cells in the first row to control the size of the columns. You can toggle Column Sizing on and off by selecting the table and clicking Toggle Resizing in the Properties Panel, under Plugin.


Detached cells


By default when a table is created the cells remain connected to their main component. To disable this and detached them when the table is created, open the plugin UI window click icon with the three dots and enable Detached Cells.


Switching between columns or rows


Change a table from columns or rows or vice versa


  1. Select a table
  2. Then from the Properties Panel under Plugin click Switch Axes.


Using with plugin parameters


You can create tables easily using plugin parameters. Using the Quick Actions bar search for "Create Table" and then press tab.


  1. Choose the template you want your table to be created from
  2. Choose how many columns and rows you want your table to have, eg 4x10 (4 columns and 10 rows)
  3. Choose what size you want your table to be, eg 600xHUG
  4. Press enter to create the table


Duplicating tables


When you duplicate a table that was created using Column Resizing (default), it contains a local component for the first row. That means when it's duplicated, the copy is intrinsically linked. To get around this you can either reapply column sizing or detach the table and it's rows.


Warning: This is quite an intensive process so it can take up to a couple of minutes.


  1. Select a table
  2. Then from the Properties Panel under Plugin click Toggle Resizing or Detach Table.


Inserting a column


Adding a new column after creating a table can be a little tricky. The plugin has a command which makes this easier. Just select a table or a specific cell and run Insert Column from the Quick Actions menu. Then select whether you want the new column to appear before or after the selected cell and how many columns you want to be inserted.


Configuring a template


If you remove or change any parts of the template you may need to re-configure the template.


Choose a template to configure:


  1. Run the command Create Table
  2. Select the dropdown at the top of the UI window
  3. Make sure Local Templates is selected
  4. Hover over the template you wish to configure
  5. Click the pencil icon


To configure parts of the template:


  1. Select a layer inside the template on the canvas
  2. Now in the plugin window, hover over a part in the list and click the plus icon
  3. If you want to remove a part from the configuration, just click the minus icon


Some layers can't be configured as certain parts. When configuring a part, make sure the part is not a group, or vector.


Moving table components


If you want to move any of the components used by the plugin to another file you can do this by following the guidance from Figma on moving components.


Relinking tables to templates

  2. Merging cells is not supported. Unfortunately, it's too difficult to enable this reliably.
  3. The only way to create columns that hug to their contents is to switch axes to columns
  4. If you create a table without a header and use Column Resizing the text is replicated in each cell in the column
  5. Support for hover states on rows is unfortunately not possible because rows are not built using components (that's how the plugin allows you to resize columns). There are workarounds but they don't suit every use case.

plugins.name: Blush
plugins.description:
Create and customize illustrations in your designs with Blush. Just choose a collection, pick a composition, and place it on the canvas. You can keep playing with the variations in the illustration to create something unique that fits your brand.


MIX-AND-MATCH

Blush works with mixable elements, so you can customize every variablee of an illustration to create your own unique compositions. It's like playing with legos, made of vectors.


RANDOM

If you’re feeling lucky, just click the Random button to shuffle the components in a composition. Embrace the chaos! (controlled chaos)


ARTISTS

You'll have access to gorgeous illustrations by artists from around the globe. We're collaborating with some of the most talented illustrators to keep creating collections with unique styles every week.


FREE LICENSE

We have a forever-free plan that allows you to use any illustration for personal and commercial purposes. Just create an account to start designing stuff! Worry-free!


SVG & HI-RES

If you need SVG, more control over the layers, color filters, print-level resolution, and other advanced functionality, subscribe to our paid plan. Your support will help bring more amazing illustrators to Blush (and support our caffeine addiction.)


We can’t wait to see what you create with Blush!


Share your creations with the hashtag #madewithblush

plugins.name: Clay Mockups 3D
plugins.description:
Create mockups with 3D clay-style device models. Customize the color, camera angle, and device model for your mockups. Includes models for the iPhone 11, Pixel 4, and Macbook Pro.


How to use:


  1. Run Clay Mockups 3D from the plugin menu
  2. Choose a device model
  3. Select any layer to render it on the device's screen. For best results select a layer that's close to the device's screen dimensions (or the same aspect ratio). If it's not exact that's fine, images will be placed similar to Figma's 'Fill' setting for image fills. To create a frame with the right dimensions click the "Create Empty Frame" button.
  4. To change the camera angle select an angle preset or click and drag over the device. Alternatively you can set an exact rotation in degrees on the right. You can also modify the rotation of the model itself there.
  5. Choose a device color. If you have local color styles click the color swatch to choose one, or manually enter a hex code.
  6. Click "Save as Image" to render the current view as an image layer in Figma.
  7. To edit the mockup after it's been saved, select the layer and click "Edit Mockup" under Plugin on the properties panel. This will allow you to apply any updates made to its screen layer, or change any of its other settings.

plugins.name: Stark - Contrast & Accessibility Checker
plugins.description:
Tired of manually checking spreadsheets, messy handovers, and expensive retrofitting? The all-new Stark Suite is a powerful combination of integrated tools that help you streamline your accessibility workflow.


Now, you can create and test accessible software in record time. Whether you’re building a website, online shop, mobile app, or SaaS product, Stark gives every designer, engineer, PM, and QA expert the manual and automated tools to make it accessible with ease.


With tools like Contrast Checker, Focus Order, Alt-Text Annotations, Vision Simulator, and more all in one place, you can find accessibility issues in a design before it goes into production—or quickly analyze and fix what’s already in flight. Get started for free today!


Auto Scan and Fix with Sidekick

Designing with accessibility in mind just got ten times faster. Automatically scan your Figma files and, in only seconds, you’ll get suggestions for how to fix the accessibility issues in your design – no prior knowledge needed!


Contrast Checker with Color Suggestions

Check contrast ratios and get color suggestions to ensure your design always adheres to AA or AAA requirements. We'll even pull in local and remote library colors so you can compare with other colors in your design system.


Vision Simulator

Simulate what your design may look like for people with different types of vision, including 4 different forms of color blindness, as well as blurred vision, loss of contrast, ghosting, yellowing, and bright light simulations.


Vision Generator

Generate any simulation as a frame that lives alongside your existing design, so you can give your team a better sense of what people with different vision types might see.


Landmarks and Focus Order

Design for easy navigation with Landmarks and Focus Order, allowing anyone to experience your product with screen readers and other assistive technologies. Add notes to help your teammates during the handoff process.


Alt-Text Annotations

Get actionable suggestions when writing and testing for alt text optimized for screen reader users and even SEO ranking with search engines. We'll generate suggestions (in 5 languages!) if you're having trouble coming up with something.


Typography Analysis

Analyze the typography in your design to check that fonts and type styles are legible and readable for people with different vision types. Apply any changes to a single layer or all the layers that have the same font settings.


Touch Targets

Ensure touch targets in your mobile design and code are large enough for everyone to complete tasks with a tap.


Accessibility Notes

Make handoff a breeze by annotating your design with ARIA notes, VoiceOver, TalkBack, React Native, Narrator, and more.


Let Stark help you streamline your accessibility workflow to get your team to long-term, sustained compliance faster. Learn more about us at https://getstark.co.

plugins.name: Locofy Lightning - Figma to Code in a flash
plugins.description:
Figma to React, HTML/CSS, Angular, Next.js, Gatsby, Vue with Locofy Lightning

Figma to React Native with Locofy Classic


🚀 Transform your Figma designs into developer-friendly front-end code in a flash with Locofy Lightning! Effortlessly build full apps, screens, components, and design systems at lightning speed. Experience the future of design-to-code with our cutting-edge technology.


► Discover Locofy Lightning at www.locofy.ai


► Watch our Demo


🌐 Powered by LocoAI


- Locofy Lightning harnesses the power of LocoAI which uses our innovative Large Design Models (LDMs). This AI-driven engine is trained on millions of designs, enabling it to understand and convert designs with unprecedented accuracy and detail.


- LDM's deep learning capabilities mean it continuously improves, evolving with every design it processes. This ensures that Locofy Lightning stays at the forefront of design-to-code technology, offering you the most efficient, up-to-date conversion experience.


- With LDM, you get more than just code conversion. It intelligently identifies design patterns, suggests optimal UI components, and provides smart suggestions to enhance your designs, all while ensuring code is clean, responsive, and maintainable.


- Import your Design System & Custom components from CLI, GitHub & Storybook. LocoAI automatically maps your Custom Components to the equivalent Figma component and Locofy will optimally reuse your components pre filling the props while generating code.


🎨 Design to Code in a flash with the Locofy Plugin


Locofy your entire Figma project or just a single layer, we give you the flexibility to convert anything you select to code.


When you make any changes to your design after converting it to code, Locofy is smart enough to only regenerate the code for the edited layers


Locofy Lightning will automatically


- Optimize your Figma design for auto-layout with proper layer grouping


- Auto-tag interactive elements like buttons, inputs, drop-downs and semantically correct tags, with support for UI libraries like Material UI, Ant and more


- Make your single layout responsive, working seamlessly on desktop, mobile and tablet


- Automatically map your design across multiple breakpoints for customized responsiveness


- Reuse your Custom Components or Create new components with props for cleaner, modular code


- Optimise layer and class names for cleaner code & collaboration


- Customize your setup with various settings (CSS Modules, Tailwind, TypeScript, etc.)


- Give you an interactive preview to test the end user experience, and share with the wider team for feedback


- Give you clean, modular code that you can extend in Locofy Builder



🔨 Finetune & Optimise


- Like any AI, LocoAI will get a few things wrong. You can review all decisions, edit and optimise anytime


- LocoAI will learn and improve



💻 Locofy Builder - Extend, Export or Sync your code


- Share a responsive and interactive prototype running on live code with your stakeholders to get early feedback


- Add data binding, meta tags, conditional rendering & custom scripts seamlessly in Locofy Builder


- Export Code or Storybook files


- Import Code directly in VS Code using Locofy's extension or Figma's extension


- Sync Code with Github using Smart Merge and three way Conflict Resolution for continuous improvements


- Create your design system & manage your components with ease


How to Start

1. Click "Try it out" on this page.

2. Optimize your designs by following Figma best practices

3. Run the Locofy plugin on your Figma page.

4. Click Locofy Lightning

5. Preview live code, fine-tune then sync to Locofy Builder.

6. Create components, share prototypes, and export or deploy your code.

► See amazing web and mobile apps built using Locofy!


► Learn more about how to convert your Figma design to React, React Native, HTML/CSS, Angular, Nextjs, Vue, Gatsby and more.


► Your feedback is invaluable! Contact us at support@locofy.ai


► Join our conversation with the Locofy community on Discord!

plugins.name: Map Maker
plugins.description:
Map Maker allows you to make a customized map blazing fast.

It currently supports Google Maps.


We are planing to support other map hosting service as well.


■ Easy To Use


Select any layer including Rectangle, Ellipse or even Polygon, and run Map Maker.


■ Fully Customizable


These are the options you have to customize your Map!


[Google Maps]

1. Address

2. Map Types (including roadmap, satellite, hybrid, and terrain)

3. Zoom Level

4. Showing Marker

5. Custom JSON using Google Maps API's Styling Wizard or Snazzy Maps


■ Editable


What if you want to edit your address? or change the zoom level after making your map?


You can select and run Map Maker again.

It saves all your customization to your layer.


■ Live Preview

You can see the actual output live on your canvas, while editing your map.


---


■ Feeback

If you have any feeback please feel free to open an issue.

https://github.com/kawamurakazushi/figma-map-maker/issues

plugins.name: Figmotion
plugins.description:
Figmotion is an animation tool built right in Figma. This makes the entry into animation easier and more convenient as there is no need to switch to a completely separate motion tool such as Principle, Haiku or After Effects. Figmotion makes the animation hand-off to developers more manageable as well as it is built with web technologies in mind.


Learn more about how to use Figmotion:

https://docs.figmotion.app/


Join the Slack channel

https://join.slack.com/t/figmotion/shared_invite/zt-1l2ivvyet-6GFIGoydIdI64FCVbs40NQ


Features


Separated UI to free your Figma viewport

The full Figmotion editor runs in a separate window so you can place your timeilne wherever you want. This is especially useful for using split-screen or when using multiple monitors.


Animating with expressions

Figmotion allows you to use expressions to animate your layers. This allows you to create advanced animations with ease.


Export to Lottie files (beta)

You can export your animations to a Lottie JSON file which allows your developers to easily embed the animation inside the final design.


Render your animations

You can export your animation to different formats such as GIF, MP4 and WEBM.

accepted.name: Liam Martens
accepted.description: Full Stack Developer & Figma Enthusiast

plugins.tagline: Bringing motion to your Figma designs

plugins.name: Figma to HTML with Framer
plugins.description:
Export Figma to HTML for free with Framer

Copy, paste, and publish. Export your Figma designs by simply copying what's on the canvas and pasting it in Framer. This Figma to HTML plugin takes care of adapting your design to Framer’s layout tools in real time, so you can focus solely on making a great website.


  1. Learn more at www.framer.com/figma
  2. Check out our Free SaaS UI Kit for Figma & Framer: Live Framer Demo Website →


How to use this plugin:

  1. Install the Free Figma plugin
  2. Copy your Figma designs
  3. Paste in Framer
  4. Continue editing like in Figma
  5. Make it responsive
  6. Add effects and animations
  7. Add pages & links
  8. Publish to a free domain


Watch the video tutorial at https://www.framer.com/academy/lessons/import-from-figma


Skip the manual HTML conversion process.

The Framer workflow is optimized for going from Figma to website with ease. The cool thing about this is that you don't have to convert your design to code — with Framer, you can paste your Figma file into Framer and publish it as-is. All layer names and groups are fully preserved.


All layer names and groups are fully preserved.

Your layer structure and naming will all be carried over, so it is easy to pick up where you've left off. You can continue editing your website and make it more engaging, or you can simply hit the publish button.


Exporting with ease.

When you publish with Framer, we make sure your site is built using all the best practices, so it loads quickly on mobile devices and gets a good ranking in Google search results. We convert your design mockups into HTML, CSS, and React code. We also optimize for performance by minifying all the JavaScript and image files.

plugins.name: Contrast
plugins.description:
Contrast makes it easy to check the contrast ratios of colors as you work. Select a layer and Contrast will immediately look for the color directly behind your selection and serve up the contrast ratio along with passing and failing levels from the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG). If Contrast cannot find the background color, add another layer to your selection, and Contrast will compare them both.


Are you looking to give everything a once-over before finishing? Scan entire pages to generate a report of all text-based contrast issues. Step through them and fix issues as needed.


  • Select elements to automatically find the color behind them
  • Scan entire pages or the current selection to see all text-layer color issues
  • Works on any element, not just text
  • Extremely fast and responsive—keep it open as you work
  • Supports image and gradient backgrounds with Smart Sampling
  • Supports solid, transparent, blended fills, layered fills, and backgrounds
  • Live updates as you change the color, opacity, or blend of the selected element


APCA Support (Beta)

Contrast now includes Beta support for the Advanced Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) algorithm. Calculate contrast using APCA, a new method for calculating and predicting readability contrast. This method is continuously evolving. APCA W3 is in public beta and use of the algorithm in Contrast is a work in progress. Please share your thoughts with us! We'll continue to post updates and new approaches over time.


Smart Sampling

Contrast can compare an element’s color with the colors it finds in gradients and images in the background. It does this by taking a sampling of colors from the area directly behind the element and calculating the contrast ratio for each color. Contrast considers a color passing if all colors in the sample pass.


Bugs

If you have a situation where Contrast is not finding the right background, please let us know! Send us an example test case in Figma along with a short description of what you were expecting, and we’ll have a look.


Known Issues

  • Element strokes are not yet supported


Smart Sampling Technique

Contrast uses RGBQuant to analyze the selection of pixels behind an element. It looks for colors (pixels) that are represented two or more times within each sub-region (64x64) of the area tested. This method gives the best balance of speed and results. The time it takes Contrast to sample and analyze the colors is proportional to the size of the layer you are testing. I.e., Larger layers, in terms of area, will take longer than smaller areas. Sampling can temporarily block the interface in the same way that exporting a frame might—this shouldn’t be very noticeable for smaller layers.


Credits

Contrast was made by the WillowTree design team.

accepted.description: Human-centered design is how we build great digital experiences, and how we’ve built our business.

plugins.name: Wireframe Designer
plugins.description:
Unleash your design creativity and productivity with ease. Describe your vision, design with a single click!


Features:

  1. Design for Mobile or Desktop
  2. Diverse and flexible components: Carefully curated with adaptable layouts to match your design requirements and unlock more design possibilities.
  3. Not satisfied with the initial design? Provide feedback and iterate until it's perfect!


Tips:


Add contextual information:

  1. Click the icon on the top left and write more about your product background and target users.
  2. Example prompt: “Rello is a fashion e-commerce platform primarily used by females aged 40-60”


Design!

  1. Enter your design task in the main page
  2. Example prompt: “Home page showcasing popular products, popular categories and customer reviews”


Provide General Feedback:

  1. Select a generated design and provide overall improvement instructions.
  2. Example prompt: “make the page shorter”, “make the copywriting more attractive”


Provide Specific Feedback:

  1. Select a section of the design and provide more detailed improvement instructions for that area.
  2. Example prompt: “change to 6 products in 2 columns”, “add a review section below”


Create Sitemaps:

  1. Use a satisfactory design as a template to generate additional pages for the entire site or app, maintaining consistent navigation.
  2. Example prompt: “keep the same navigation, design the FAQ page”


Create user flows:

  1. Select a design and generate subsequent pages based on the user actions given.
  2. Example prompt: “design the next page when users tap on the continue button”


10 free designs per month, upgrade to Pro version for unlimited inspirations and customised support!


Feel free to DM @WCMuu on Twitter or email contact@describe.design for inquiries.


The subscription and payment of the plugin is managed by Figma marketplace. You can follow this help center link to unsubscribe: managing plugin subscriptions →. 

When you cancel a subscription, you can still access the plugin until the end of the current billing cycle.

plugins.name: TinyImage Compressor
plugins.description:
Documentation & Video Tutorials


For plugin documentation and step by step video tutorials, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/tinyimage


Questions & Support


TinyImage is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions about the plugin, please get in touch directly via https://hypermatic.com/contact and we'll help you troubleshoot and resolve them as quickly as possible.


Security


TinyImage is designed to be privacy and security focused — for details about security and how the plugin works, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/tinyimage/security


Features


  1. Exports images up to 95% smaller than the default exports from Figma.
  2. Privacy focused — no image data ever leaves your Figma file.
  3. Create and export animated GIFs, WebPs, WebMs or MP4 videos from selected layers (with optional transition effects).
  4. Optionally add .mp3 audio files to MP4 video exports.
  5. Downsize and compress your Figma image fills to their layer size.
  6. Built-in ICC color profile support for PNG exports.
  7. Convert JPG and PNGs to WebP, AVIF, Progressive JPEG, or SVG to Tiny 1.2 format.
  8. Use percentage based compression, or maximum KB file size targets.
  9. Set specific compression level overrides per image.
  10. Merge Figma frames into a single compressed PDF file.
  11. Add custom password protection to exported PDF files.
  12. Export PDFs as RGB, CMYK or Greyscale (with optional Bleed and Crop Marks).
  13. Supports compressing/exporting multiple sizes and formats per layer.
  14. Advanced custom filenames (eg. "#{name}_#{width}x#{height}_#{date}).
  15. Automatically saves multiple images as a .zip file.


It’s like “Ludicrous Mode” for your Figma image export options.

Don’t waste time manually dragging images exported from Figma into other apps to compress images one by one. It’s so easy, a cat can use it.


Simple, fast and effective image compression directly in Figma.

Easily export compressed JPG, PNG, SVG, WebP, AVIF, GIF and PDF images from Figma without needing any other apps or websites.


Up to 95% smaller than the image exports from Figma.

Even without using aggressive compression levels, TinyImage will drastically compress your image exports from Figma, making them friendly your websites, apps, emails, presentations or banners.


Privacy and security focused — nothing ever leaves your Figma file.

TinyImage doesn’t upload, store or process any image data outside of the plugin, everything happens securely inside your Figma file, and any exported files are downloaded directly to your computer.


Downsize Figma image fills to their layer size.

Speed up and optimize your Figma files by automatically downscaling Figma image fills to their layer size. Perfect for those tiny 64px avatar layers with huge 4000px image fills.


Export custom animated GIFs or MP4s from any layers.

TinyImage lets you easily create animated GIFs, animated WebPs or WebM and MP4 videos (with optional audio and frame transition effects) directly from your selected layers. You have total control over the speed, playback counts, image smoothing and scaling.


Advanced settings for Figma power users.

Convert image formats, add passwords to PDFs, set custom ICC color profiles, or mix & match your own text with dynamic values from each Figma layer into any naming format you like to suit you or your clients.


Get huge savings with super tiny PDFs.

TinyImage supports optimising PDF exports, saving up to 95% on their original exported filesize. Export individual frames or merge them into a single PDF, super easy page re-ordering, export as RGB, CMYK or greyscale (with optional Bleed and Crop Marks), and secure the files with password protection.


TinyImage Pro


10 free trials of TinyImage Pro are included with the free version, and if you're a casual user, you can continue using the free version of TinyImage forever.


If you're a power user, you can optionally upgrade to continue using all the extra features that are only available in the pro version of TinyImage.


To learn more about TinyImage Pro, please visit https://www.hypermatic.com/tinyimage/#pro

plugins.name: Convertify Sketch/Adobe/Google
plugins.description:
Documentation & Video Tutorials


For plugin documentation and step-by-step video tutorials, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/convertify


Questions & Support


Convertify is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions about the plugin, please get in touch directly via https://hypermatic.com/contact and we'll help you troubleshoot and resolve them as quickly as possible.


Security


Convertify is designed to be privacy and security focused — for details about security and how the plugin works, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/convertify/security


Features


  1. One-click, automatic conversion from Figma to Sketch, Adobe XD, After Effects or EPS.
  2. Import your Adobe XD files, PDF files, Adobe Illustrator files, SVG files, or Google Docs/Sheets into Figma with one click.
  3. Import PNG/JPG bitmap images as vectorized SVG layers with the image tracer feature.
  4. Converts each artboard (layer-by-layer) to a real .sketch or .xd file.
  5. Simple pages converted in seconds; larger pages in minutes.
  6. Converts almost all layer styles and properties (see below for details).
  7. Includes color and text style libraries from Figma.
  8. Convert your Figma Components to Sketch/XD Symbols.
  9. Natively export artboards to After Effects from Adobe XD with converted .xd file.
  10. Includes all supported prototype links from Figma.
  11. Download the exported .sketch, .xd or .eps file to your computer from Figma.


Expecting more than one click? We’re sorry happy to disappoint.

Don’t waste days re-creating designs from between different design tools and formats; just click one button and you’re done. It’s so easy, a cat can use it.


Automatically convert design file formats with one click.

Click one button to convert your design from Figma to Sketch, Figma to Adobe XD, Figma to After Effects, Figma to EPS, or Adobe XD to Figma, Adobe Illustrator to Figma, PDF to Figma, and Google Docs to Figma.


Privacy and security focused — nothing ever leaves your Figma file.

Convertify doesn’t upload or process any of your design data online, everything happens securely inside your Figma file, and converted files are downloaded directly to your computer.


Import your designs from Adobe XD to Figma in seconds.

Drop your .xd file into Convertify and your layers, styles, components and prototypes are magically converted and imported in seconds.


Includes your components, color styles, text styles and prototype links.

Automatically includes your color styles, text styles and supported prototype links from Figma in your Sketch or Adobe XD files, and Adobe XD to Figma.


Use your Figma artboards for animated motion design in Adobe After Effects.

If you're looking to use your artboards for motion design, now you can easily get export Figma to After Effects via the native Adobe XD export.


Import your Adobe Illustrator or PDF files to Figma in seconds.

Drop your .ai or .pdf file into Convertify and import your content as flat image layers or vector layers.


Automatically convert an image to vector and import the editable layers into Figma.

Drop your .jpg, .png or .webp image file into Convertify and automatically import your converted bitmap as SVG vector layers into Figma.


It’s like alchemy for your Figma export options.

Convertify is the missing exporter to convert your files from Figma to Sketch, Figma to Adobe XD, Figma to After Effects, Figma to EPS, or Adobe XD to Figma, Adobe Illustrator to Figma, PDF to Figma, and Google Docs to Figma.


Convertify Pro


10 free trials of Convertify Pro are included with the free version, and if you're a casual user, you can continue using the free version of Convertify forever.


If you're a power user, you can optionally upgrade to continue using all the extra features that are only available in the pro version of Convertify.


To learn more about Convertify Pro, please visit https://www.hypermatic.com/convertify/#pro

plugins.description:
Create smooth and beautiful shadows.


The plugin allows you to create beautiful shadows by simply dragging a 'light source' which casts a shadow on selected elements.


The plugin outputs valid box-shadow CSS styles. Grab the CSS values from the Figma Inspect panel (next to the Prototype tab✌️)

plugins.name: Avatars
plugins.description:
Add random user avatars to your designs with one click!

Select any type of element and run the plugin. It will fetch an avatar image and add it as a fill on your selected element.

You can also run the plugin without anything selected and it will add an element with an avatar.

Images are aggregated by UIfaces.co from various sources including randomuser.me, tinyfac.es, imdb.com, donated images, and other sources.
